item.title: I Can't Do Anything for Fun Anymore; Every Hobby Is an Attempt to Make Money
item.author: dave@bennettnotes.com (Dave Bennett)
item.description: When I was a kid, it was easy to merrily invest myself in any activity that I found interesting. Building robots, learning to play guitar, and making short films were things that I would work on after school everyday. I did all those things simply because I enjoyed doing them. Now, as a young adult, I feel like I completely lost that spontaneity and simple mindset. Every project which I take up has become an attempt to make money.
